data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You should always face forward in these instructions. It is considered a forward motion. So, the answer is No.

Turn around is a form of turning. The other way around is to turn right and go back to where you started from. Thus, the answer is yes.

This pattern of walking is a standard way of travelling. If you walk in a straight line through 4 objects, each pointing towards something of the same direction, you will always face forward. Since, the first step of the pattern was to take 9 steps left, you can take 9 steps left, and 3 takes 3 steps left. The first step of the second part of pattern is to take 3 steps left, and 1 steps right. The second part of the pattern is to take 13 steps left, and 4 steps right. So, the answer is No.
